title: 107_hr1807
content: The "Immigrant Labor Policy Review Act" establishes the High Level Commission on Immigrant Labor Policy to address labor shortages in various industries and their impact on the US economy and standard of living. The Commission will study the interactions between Federal immigration policy and labor markets for aliens in the US, including the adequacy of the labor supply, reliance on temporary workforce, economic impact of caps on nonimmigrant workers, reliance on unlawfully present aliens in the workforce, and unemployment of US citizens and lawful aliens. The Commission will study the effectiveness of US labor policies in stopping illegal immigration and consult with various groups and agencies to prepare required reports. The Commission will study US labor policies to stop illegal immigration and consult with groups and agencies to prepare reports. SEC. 5. MEMBERSHIP. The Commission consists of 10 members appointed by various officials, with consultations required for some appointments. Each member serves a specific term. The Commission consists of 10 members appointed for the life of the Commission. Vacancies are filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The Chairperson is the Chairman of the Federal Reserve Board or their designee until a chairperson is elected. Members serve without pay but receive travel expenses. A majority of members forms a quorum for meetings called by the chairperson. SEC. 6. DIRECTOR AND STAFF; EXPERTS AND CONSULTANTS. The Commission shall have a director appointed by the chairperson, who can also appoint additional staff. The director and staff may be appointed without following certain civil service laws, but their pay cannot exceed the maximum for GS-15. The chairperson may also procure temporary experts and consultants. The chairperson can hire temporary experts and consultants at rates not exceeding the daily equivalent of the maximum annual pay for GS-15. Federal agencies can detail personnel to assist the Commission on a reimbursable basis. SEC. 7. POWERS. The chairperson of the Commission has the authority to obtain official data from Federal agencies, use the United States mails, request administrative support services from the Administrator of General Services, and contract with government and private agencies for research and other necessary services. The Commission chairperson has the authority to obtain official data, request administrative support services, and contract with government and private agencies for research and other necessary services. SEC. 8. REPORTS. The Commission must submit an interim report within 6 months of the Act's enactment, evaluating the effectiveness of Federal immigration and labor laws in protecting jobs for citizens, preventing exploitation of immigrant workers, and reducing illegal border crossings. The Commission will evaluate the impact of immigration laws on reducing illegal employment, entry of immigrants, border measures, and economic performance in various sectors like agriculture, tourism, construction, nursing, and apparel. The Commission will submit a final report to the President and Congress within a year of the Act's enactment. The report will include updated findings and recommendations to address illegal border crossings, unlawful employment of aliens, and protection of workers in various sectors like nursing, health care, apparel, and information technology. The Commission will submit a final report to the President and Congress within a year of the Act's enactment, including recommendations for expanding the agricultural guest worker program to industries like tourism, construction, nursing, apparel, and information technology. Additionally, the report will address ways to improve Federal immigration and labor laws or policies. SEC. 9. TERMINATION. The Commission will terminate 6 months after submitting its final report under section 8(b). SEC. 10. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Sums necessary for carrying out this Act are authorized to be appropriated and will remain available until expended.
